properties.title: Agi's Counter
properties.description: A is for Agi‚Äôs Counter: a recent addition to Crown Heights, my neighborhood! Agi‚Äôs is a modern Jewish/Hungarian take on the traditional lunch counter, serving up delicious staples full of flavor. The motif in this illustration is a traditional folk tulip, the national flower of Hungary, as their wine list is 100% Hungarian.

properties.title: Bunny
properties.description: B is for Bunny, a wonderful little gem in Bed-Stuy. Bunny serves modern Turkish fare with an ever-changing daily menu, so you know you‚Äôre getting the freshest and the best. I was inspired by traditional Iznik handpainted tile for this one.

properties.title: Bar Camillo
properties.description: C is for Bar Camillo. Where do I even begin with this restaurant, one of my absolute favorites? They‚Äôre a sister restaurant of the esteemed Locanda in Clinton Hill, but their menu is focused on Roman pinsa and a long list of Negroni specialities. You absolutely must order the insalata di cicoria, it‚Äôs the most simple and heavenly salad that I could never go without. The anchovies are pretty spectacular, too.

properties.title: Do or Dive
properties.description: D for Do or Dive, one of my Bed-Stuy staples. Cheap drinks, good vibes, dogs allowed. Order the Coffee Thing in the summer and hang out in the backyard. This place really knows how to hit the spot üíØ

properties.title: Elsa
properties.description: E for Elsa, one of my favorite cocktail bars. When I used to work nearby, this was my staple for happy hour ‚Äî I love their generous and luxe cheese boards and sazeracs on the cheap. Their interior design is KILLER, even the bathrooms feel like an experience.

properties.title: Fiaschetteria 'Pistoia'
properties.description: One of my favorite things about living in New York is you can wander down any given street and find some of the best food you never knew was there. Fisachetteria Pistoia became a go-to whenever I have a hankering for pasta after happening upon it in the West Village, because their cacio e pepe with handrolled pici is to die for, and their house wine carafe served with tiny duralex glasses transports me immediately to Italy.

properties.title: Golda
properties.description: I love a cafe / restaurant combo and this is one of the best, melding mouthwatering mediterranean flavors into breakfast pastries, lunch sandwiches, and dinner plates „Ä∞Ô∏è their breakfast sandwich with harissa jam is not to be missed, & I‚Äôm only a little obsessed with their branding & interior design.

properties.title: Hart's
properties.description: Hart‚Äôs is well known for good reason. It can be hard to get a reservation for their tiny dining space, but I always have luck walking in for a waitlist table and grabbing a cocktail at Glorietta Baldy next door while I wait (almost made my G for them!) - makes for a great night out.

properties.title: I Sodi
properties.description: ah, the elusive white whale of my NYC Italian dining adventure. I almost ate here once, but a couple ran, literally RAN, to beat my boyfriend and I to the door as we walked up and they got the last open table. Someday I‚Äôll check this one off my list, or maybe I‚Äôll just go back to Italy ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

properties.title: Jack's Wife Freda
properties.description: A stand-by staple for all occasions. This has been a go-to since one of my first trips to New York before I moved here; I sat alone in a corner table and had green shakshuka and a cocktail while I read a book ‚Ä¶ I felt SO incredibly ~new yorker~  There are multiple locations and you can‚Äôt go wrong with any of them, unless you‚Äôre looking for a big table for brunch because you‚Äôll be waiting for hours. But it‚Äôs probably worth the wait.

properties.title: Kubeh
properties.description: Mediterranean & Middle Eastern cuisines are one of my all-time favorite. Kubeh has a fantastic selection of mezes and yummy things, and they have arak service with multiple options which is just truly *chefs kiss*

properties.title: Lupa
properties.description: A friend of mine used to work at this cozy Roman restaurant, and it was such a fun place to visit and sit at the bar during her shift. This is where my love for amaro began üñ§

properties.title: Miss Ada
properties.description: A can‚Äôt-miss Mediterranean masterpiece. I have dreams about the whipped ricotta and sweet potato hummus. Their name is a play on the Hebrew word for restaurant, ‚Äòmisada‚Äô. This design is inspired by traditional Israeli paper cutting, which is a gorgeous thing to google.

properties.title: Neptune Diner
properties.description: There‚Äôs a special place in my heart for classic diners. I always find one when I‚Äôm on a trip, but have a lot left in New York to try. Neptune Diner is in my neighborhood on the border of Crown Heights & Prospect Heights, and next time I‚Äôm craving a tuna melt, I‚Äôm headed this way. One of my great loves and inspiration for this matchbox is midcentury space graphics.

properties.title: Oxomoco
properties.description: A Michelin-starred Mexican restaurant in Greenpoint. Their menu is entirely small sharing plates which is one of my favorite ways to eat ‚Äî a little bite of everything, please!

properties.title: Pietro Nolita
properties.description: Pietro Nolita - the most pink restaurant you‚Äôll ever find yourself in, in a cozy half basement in Nolita. their specialties are Italian classics, and I‚Äôve never been so pleased with a plate of spaghetti pomodoro üçù

properties.title: Quan Sushi
properties.description: It was tough finding a restaurant that started with a Q! I haven‚Äôt been to Quan but it looks delicious, and I‚Äôll take sushi any day of the week (okay yes sometimes every day) üç£üç£üç£

properties.title: Rialto Grande
properties.description: My favorite local bar in Crown Heights üñ§ They have amazing cocktails, great bartenders, plenty of gold tinsel, and the whole place just feels like being cozy inside a mid century credenza. Highly recommend üíØ

properties.title: Sm√∏r
properties.description: I love Scandinavian flavors soOoOo much, gimme all the dill & black licorice & cardamom & smoked salmon! I found Sm√∏r when I had a hankering for a cardamom bun and it became an instant favorite üíï they have more than pastries, too, with (very good) Nordic-inspired lunch and dinner.

properties.title: Taiyaki
properties.description: Taiyaki is a baked fish-shaped cone stuffed with bean curd or custard, and filled with soft serve üç¶ I die. You can get any combo of toppings, I highly recommend the stick of mochi. Matcha is my favorite soft-serve flavor so here‚Äôs a green scaly T üíö

properties.title: Ume
properties.description: A true sushi ex-per-i-ence üç£‚ú® Leave your shoes at the door and sidle up to a platter of beautiful diy sushi & sashimi. Ume makes for a really fun date night or a spot to bring friends from out of town for something unique!

properties.title: Vanessa's Dumpling House
properties.description: I‚Äôm always down for dumplings, and this classic hits the spot every time ü•ü It‚Äôll always feel extra special to me as it played a big part in my boyfriend‚Äôs and my early dating <3  all I can say is, order everything you can and you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

properties.title: Wildair
properties.description: W for Wildair, one of the first places I had truly good scallops (!) and their natural wine list is no joke. a truly great spot for some small plates in the lower east side ü´∂

properties.title: Bar Tulix
properties.description: X for Bar Tulix - a new Mexican spot by the same crew as Oxomoco (see my ‚ÄòO‚Äô matchbox!). Their seafood-forward menu looks incredible üêüü¶êüêô

properties.title: Amor Y Amargo
properties.description: A cocktail bar specializing solely in bitters, I have had some truly creative and delicious drinks here. The way they recreate classics & come up with entirely new flavors using only amari is incredible!

properties.title: Zucker's Bagels & Smoked Fish
properties.description: It wouldn‚Äôt be a New York restaurant series without a bagel shop, and Zucker‚Äôs has never let me down. What‚Äôs your go-to bagel spot?? üëÄü•Ø

properties.title: Zero Otto Nove
properties.description: Zero for Zero Otto Nove - I‚Äôm a little shocked I‚Äôve made it through 27 restaurants in NYC and this is only the second pizza spot. This is a Neapolitan pizzeria in the Bronx that has been on my list for a long time - conventiently for me, they also have a location in lower Manhattan

properties.title: 1 If By Land, 2 If By Sea
properties.description: This is a classic, romantic American restaurant in the heart of Greenwich Village, named after an iconic phrase from Longfellow‚Äôs poem ‚ÄòPaul Revere‚Äôs Ride‚Äô. It references Revere‚Äôs secret signal to inform the route the British were taking at the outset of the Revolutionary War üïØÔ∏èüêéüõ∂

properties.title: Rule of Thirds
properties.description: Rule of Thirds in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, is a phenomenal Japanese restaurant. Have had very fun times with friends here, the menu is perfect for sharing lots of things. Their hamachi collar is incredible - this was the first place I had a fish collar and was a little confused at first how to eat it, but very quickly forgot my manners and just tore in because it was so delicious üòã

properties.title: The Four Horsemen
properties.description: 4 is for The Four Horsemen - this natural wine bar has been on my list for a long time but I haven‚Äôt made it yet! Fun fact, it was opened by the lead singer of LCD Soundsystem ü™©

properties.title: Five Leaves
properties.description: Five Leaves in Greenpoint - this tiny corner spot is great not only for the food but also for the location! one of my favorite corners on a nice day ‚òÄÔ∏è it‚Äôs right next to McCarren Park and there‚Äôs a Saturday vintage pop-up on the sidewalk üíØ

properties.title: Bar 6
properties.description: A French Moroccan bistro in Greenwich Village. Sixth Ave is kind of a weird amalgamation of different businesses and busy traffic, but Bar Six is a friendly little hideaway from the chaos üí´ I really enjoyed drawing the tile pattern for this one üôÇ

properties.title: No. 7 Restaurant
properties.description: This spot is along Prospect Heights‚Äô ‚Äúrestaurant row‚Äù on Vanderbilt, where there are honestly just too many good places to choose from. I‚Äôve only been here for cocktails, which were phenomenal, but am excited to come back for dinner sometime! Their vibe is relaxed & friendly, but also kinda schmancy thanks to their gorgeous decor ‚ú®

properties.title: 1OR8
properties.description: A Japanese restaurant in Fort Greene. They have regular seating with a full menu, or a sushi counter for omakase ‚Äî get you a spot that can do both.

properties.title: The Nines
properties.description: A classic supper club with pianos and caviar, I cannot wait to dine here someday.
